data.text: March 2008 Vol. 21 • No. 7 Adar II 5768 “Lawfare” and “Libel Tourism”: New Tools Used by Islamists to Shut Down Their Critics Islamist groups throughout the world have found a new target in the West: the courts and the freedom of speech and due process that most Westerners take for granted. “The Islamist movement has two wings—one violent and one lawful—which operate apart but often reinforce each other. While the violent arm attempts to silence speech by burning cars when cartoons of Mohammed are published, the lawful arm is maneuvering within Western legal systems,” said Brooke M. Goldstein, a practicing attorney who serves as the director of the Legal Project at the Middle East Forum and the director of the Children’s Rights Institute.
